com.pb.sawdust.util.exceptions

Class MultiThrowable

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.exceptions.MultiThrowable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MultiThrowable
extends java.lang.Throwable
    The MultiThrowable class provides a framework where multiple Throwable instance can be wrapped into one. This is useful if a given operation (or series of operations) need to be executed as a block and throwables captured, rather than thrown, during the block call. When the block operation finishes, the single multi-throwable, which encapsulates all caught throwables, can be thrown (or dealt with).
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • setThrowableName

        protected void setThrowableName(java.lang.String throwableName)
        Set the name for the throwables held by this instance. This is used in the getMessage() method. The default is "throwable." Another common name to use could be "exception."
        Parameters:
        throwableName - The throwable name to be used with this multi-throwable.

      • setMultiThrowableName

        protected void setMultiThrowableName(java.lang.String multiThrowableName)
        Set the name for this multi-throwable. This is used in the getMessage() method. The default value is "MultiThrowable."
        Parameters:
        multiThrowableName - The name to use for this multi-throwable.
